questions.title: Addition Function with Arguments
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Addition using a function with arguments but no return value [1].
questions.solution_explanation: Define a method that takes two integers as parameters and prints their sum directly [1]. This demonstrates basic method parameters [1].

questions.title: Addition Function without Arguments
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Addition using a function with no arguments and no return value [2].
questions.solution_explanation: Implement a method that initializes two variables internally and prints their sum without receiving outside input [2].

questions.title: Matrix Addition
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Matrix addition using 2D arrays [2].
questions.solution_explanation: Use nested loops to iterate through rows and columns, adding elements of two matrices into a result matrix [2, 3].

questions.title: Anagram Check
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Check if two strings are anagrams [3].
questions.solution_explanation: Sort both strings and compare them character by character to see if they are identical [3, 4].

questions.title: Anti-Diagonal Sum
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find anti-diagonal elements of a matrix and calculate their sum [4].
questions.solution_explanation: Identify elements where row index plus column index equals size minus one and sum them [4, 5].

questions.title: Area of Circle
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate the area of a circle with a given radius [5].
questions.solution_explanation: Use the formula 3.14 multiplied by the square of the radius [5].

questions.title: Area of Rectangle
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate the area of a rectangle given length and breadth [6].
questions.solution_explanation: Multiply the length by the breadth to find the total area [6].

questions.title: Area of Triangle
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate the area of a triangle [6].
questions.solution_explanation: Apply the formula 0.5 multiplied by base and height [6].

questions.title: Armstrong Number
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Determine if a number is an Armstrong number [7].
questions.solution_explanation: Sum the cubes of each digit and check if the total equals the original number [7].

questions.title: Array Operations
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Input and display five values using an array [7].
questions.solution_explanation: Use a for loop to take user input and another to print the array contents [7, 8].

questions.title: Call by Reference Swapping
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Swap two numbers using call by reference [8].
questions.solution_explanation: Pass the addresses of variables to a function to modify their actual values [8].

questions.title: Call by Value Swapping
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Demonstrate why call by value does not swap original variables [9].
questions.solution_explanation: Observe that passing values rather than references only swaps local copies within the function [9].

questions.title: Celsius to Fahrenheit
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Convert Celsius temperature to Fahrenheit [9].
questions.solution_explanation: Multiply the Celsius value by 1.8 and add 32 to get Fahrenheit [9].

questions.title: Circumference of Circle
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate the circumference of a circle [10].
questions.solution_explanation: Apply the formula 2 multiplied by 3.14 multiplied by the radius [10].

questions.title: Compound Interest
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate Compound Interest [10].
questions.solution_explanation: Use the compound interest formula involving the power function from the math library [10].

questions.title: Count of Digits
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Count the number of digits in a given integer [11].
questions.solution_explanation: Iteratively divide the number by 10 until it becomes zero, incrementing a counter at each step [11].

questions.title: Book Data Structure
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Create and display book information using a structure [11].
questions.solution_explanation: Define a structure with members for name, author, pages, and price, then initialize and print them [11, 12].

questions.title: Divisibility Check
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Check if entered numbers are divisible by 4 [13].
questions.sample_output: 4 is divisible by 4, 8 is divisible by 4
questions.solution_explanation: Use the modulo operator to determine if the remainder is zero when divided by 4 [13].

questions.title: Do-While Loop Counting
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print a range of numbers using a do-while loop [14].
questions.solution_explanation: Execute a block once and repeat until the condition (a <= 24) is false [14].

questions.title: String Name Input
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Accept and display a name using fgets and puts [14].
questions.solution_explanation: Utilize string input/output functions to handle character arrays safely [14].

questions.title: Factorial Calculation
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate the factorial of a number iteratively [15].
questions.solution_explanation: Use a for loop to multiply numbers from 1 up to the target value [15].

questions.title: Fahrenheit to Celsius
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Convert Fahrenheit temperature to Celsius [15].
questions.solution_explanation: Subtract 32 from Fahrenheit and multiply by 0.55 [15].

questions.title: Fibonacci Series
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Generate a Fibonacci series up to 10 terms [16].
questions.solution_explanation: Calculate the next term by adding the two previous terms in the sequence [16].

questions.title: Frequency of Character
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find how many times a character appears in a string [16].
questions.solution_explanation: Traverse the string and increment a counter every time the target character is matched [16, 17].

questions.title: Hollow Diamond Pattern
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print a hollow diamond shape using stars [17].
questions.solution_explanation: Use nested loops and conditional checks for specific positions to print stars or spaces [17, 18].

questions.title: Hollow Rectangle Pattern
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print a hollow rectangle with stars [18].
questions.solution_explanation: Iterate through rows and columns, printing stars only for the first and last rows/columns [18].

questions.title: If-Else Ladder
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Compare two values and display results using a ladder [19].
questions.solution_explanation: Evaluate conditions sequentially to check for equality, greater than, or less than [19].

questions.title: Inverted Right Triangle
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print an inverted triangle pattern [19].
questions.solution_explanation: Run an outer loop backwards to decrease the number of columns printed in each row [19].

questions.title: Isogram Check
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Check if a string is an isogram [20].
questions.solution_explanation: Verify if the string contains any repeating characters [20, 21].

questions.title: Leap Year
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Determine if a year is a leap year [20].
questions.solution_explanation: Check if a year is divisible by 400 or by 4 but not by 100 [20, 22].

questions.title: Logical Operators
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Demonstrate the use of logical AND and OR operators [22].
questions.solution_explanation: Evaluate boolean expressions to see how logical operators affect true/false results [22, 23].

questions.title: Matrix Transpose
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Transpose a given 2x2 matrix [23].
questions.solution_explanation: Swap the rows and columns of a matrix using two-dimensional arrays [23, 24].

questions.title: 3x3 Matrix IO
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Accept and display a 3x3 matrix [25].
questions.solution_explanation: Use nested for-loops to scan input into a grid and print it [25].

questions.title: Matrix Multiplication
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Multiply two 2x2 matrices [25].
questions.solution_explanation: Calculate the product of matrices using three nested loops for dot products [25-27].

questions.title: Multiplication Table
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print the multiplication table for a number [26].
questions.solution_explanation: Loop from 0 or 1 up to 10 and display the product of the number and loop index [26].

questions.title: Natural Numbers
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Display first N natural numbers [28].
questions.solution_explanation: Iterate from 1 up to the user-defined limit and print each index [26, 28].

questions.title: Configurable Loops
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print a message N times based on input [28].
questions.solution_explanation: Take an integer input and use it as the termination condition for a for-loop [28].

questions.title: Orthogonal Matrix
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Determine if a 3x3 matrix is orthogonal [28].
questions.sample_output: the given matrix is orthogonal matrix
questions.solution_explanation: Verify if the matrix multiplied by its transpose yields an identity matrix [28, 29].

questions.title: Palindrome Number
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Check if an integer is a palindrome [29].
questions.solution_explanation: Reverse the digits and compare the result with the original input [29-31].

questions.title: Perimeter of Rectangle
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate the perimeter of a rectangle [30].
questions.solution_explanation: Multiply the sum of length and breadth by two [30, 32].

questions.title: Positive or Negative
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Verify if a number is positive, negative, or zero [33].
questions.solution_explanation: Use conditional statements to categorize input based on comparison to zero [30, 33-35].

questions.title: Recursive Factorial
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate factorial using recursion [33].
questions.solution_explanation: Call a function recursively decreasing N until it reaches one [33, 36, 37].

questions.title: Manual String Reversal
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Reverse a string without using library functions [36].
questions.solution_explanation: Swap characters from the beginning and end of the string moving inward [36, 38].

questions.title: Right Triangle Pattern
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print a right-angled triangle pattern [39].
questions.solution_explanation: Use nested loops where the inner loop prints stars equal to the current row number [39].

questions.title: Equatorial Triangle
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print a side equatorial triangle with different symbols [39].
questions.solution_explanation: Use one set of loops for increasing stars and another for decreasing them [39, 40].

questions.title: Simple Interest Formula
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate simple interest given P, R, and T [40].
questions.solution_explanation: Apply the calculation (P * T * R) / 100 [40, 41].

questions.title: Simple Interest Function
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate SI using a function with logic for customer types [42].
questions.solution_explanation: Implement logic to set interest rates based on customer type within a function [40, 42].

questions.title: Square Pattern
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print a 10x10 square pattern of stars [43].
questions.solution_explanation: Use nested loops running up to the same limit to create a grid [42, 43].

questions.title: Matrix Subtraction
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Subtract one matrix from another [43].
questions.solution_explanation: Subtract elements of the second matrix from the first using dual loops [43, 44].

questions.title: Matrix Sum and Average
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate total sum and average of elements in a matrix [45].
questions.solution_explanation: Traverse the 2D array, sum the items, and divide by the total number of elements [45, 46].

questions.title: Diagonal Sum
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find the sum of main diagonal elements in a matrix [47].
questions.solution_explanation: Add elements only where the row index and column index are equal [47].

questions.title: Sum of Digits
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find the sum of digits of a given integer [48].
questions.solution_explanation: Extract digits using modulo 10 and accumulate them in a sum [48, 49].

questions.title: Even and Odd Sums
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Sum even and odd numbers within a range [48].
questions.solution_explanation: Use a loop to check each number's parity and add to the respective total [48, 50, 51].

questions.title: While Loop Sum
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Sum first N natural numbers using a while loop [50].
questions.solution_explanation: Execute a while loop incrementing a counter and adding to the total [50].

questions.title: Harmonic Series Sum
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate the sum of 1 + 1/2 + 1/3 ... 1/n [52].
questions.solution_explanation: Add the reciprocal of loop index to a floating point sum [50, 52].

questions.title: Cube Series Sum
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Sum of cubes of first N numbers [52].
questions.solution_explanation: Accumulate the cube of each integer in the range into a sum [52].

questions.title: Square Series Sum
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Sum of squares of first N numbers [53].
questions.solution_explanation: Iterate and add the square of each index to a running total [53].

questions.title: Voting Eligibility
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Determine if a user is eligible to vote [53].
questions.solution_explanation: Compare the age input with the threshold of 18 [53, 54].

questions.title: Vowel or Consonant
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Check if a character is a vowel or consonant [54].
questions.solution_explanation: Identify if the character belongs to the set {a, e, i, o, u} [54-57].

questions.title: String Character Analysis
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Count vowels, consonants, digits, and spaces in a string [55].
questions.solution_explanation: Iterate through character array and increment specific counters based on character types [55, 58].

questions.title: While Loop Counting
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print numbers 1 to 10 using a while loop [58].
questions.solution_explanation: Start a counter at 1 and increment while less than or equal to 10 [58].

questions.title: Max/Min with Pointers
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find max and min in an array using pointers [59].
questions.solution_explanation: Use pointer arithmetic to traverse the array and compare elements [51, 59].

questions.title: Pointer Array Access
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Print all elements of an array using pointers [59].
questions.solution_explanation: Increment a pointer and dereference it to access and print each index [59, 60].

questions.title: Add Element to Array
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Insert an element at a specific position in an array [60].
questions.solution_explanation: Shift existing elements and assign the new value to the targeted index [60].

questions.title: Pointer Matrix Addition
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Perform matrix addition using pointers [61].
questions.solution_explanation: Access matrix elements via pointers and store their sums in a result matrix [60, 61].

questions.title: String Sort
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Sort characters of a string alphabetically [61].
questions.solution_explanation: Compare and swap adjacent characters based on their ASCII values [61].

questions.title: Basic Arithmetic
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Perform sum, sub, product, quotient, and remainder [62].
questions.solution_explanation: Execute standard mathematical operations on two integer inputs [44, 62].

questions.title: Student Record Structure
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Define a student structure and print details [62].
questions.solution_explanation: Store name, roll number, and marks in a structure and output the object fields [62].

questions.title: Bubble Sort
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Sort an array using bubble sort [63].
questions.solution_explanation: Iterate through the array swapping adjacent elements that are out of order [63].

questions.title: Pointer Bubble Sort
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Implement bubble sort using pointer notation [64].
questions.solution_explanation: Use pointers and nested loops to swap array elements until sorted [63, 64].

questions.title: Basic Calculator
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Create a calculator using a switch statement [64].
questions.solution_explanation: Direct execution flow based on user-provided operators (+, -, *, /) [64, 65].

questions.title: Character Categorizer
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Identify if a char is uppercase, lowercase, or a digit [66].
questions.solution_explanation: Check character value against specific ASCII ranges for classification [66].

questions.title: String Comparison
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Check if two strings are identical without library functions [67].
questions.solution_explanation: Loop through both strings and compare character by character; if any differ, they are not same [67].

questions.title: String Concatenation
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Join two strings manually [68].
questions.solution_explanation: Append characters of the second string to the end of the first string [67, 68].

questions.title: Pointer Concatenation
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Concatenate strings using pointers [68].
questions.solution_explanation: Navigate to the end of the first string with a pointer and copy characters from the second [68].

questions.title: String Copy Pointer
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Copy one string to another using pointers [69].
questions.solution_explanation: Iteratively assign values from source pointer to destination pointer [69].

questions.title: Manual String Copy
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Copy a string without library tools [70].
questions.solution_explanation: Transfer each index content from one character array to another until the null terminator [70].

questions.title: Delete Array Element
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Remove an element from a specific position in an array [71].
questions.solution_explanation: Shift all elements after the target index to the left and adjust total count [71].

questions.title: Digital Root
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find the digital root of a large number [71].
questions.solution_explanation: Continuously sum digits until only a single digit remains [71].

questions.title: Function Parity Check
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Determine even/odd using a boolean-return function [72].
questions.solution_explanation: Use a function to return 1 for even and 0 for odd after modulo check [72].

questions.title: HCF Calculation
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find Highest Common Factor of two numbers [73].
questions.solution_explanation: Identify the largest integer that divides both inputs without a remainder [73].

questions.title: LCM Function
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find Least Common Multiple using a function [74].
questions.solution_explanation: Loop to find the smallest number divisible by both inputs starting from the maximum of the two [21, 74].

questions.title: String Length
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate string length manually [74].
questions.solution_explanation: Count characters until the null character is reached [74].

questions.title: Pointer String Length
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find string length using pointer arithmetic [75].
questions.solution_explanation: Increment a pointer through the string and subtract base address or use counter [75].

questions.title: Logic Range Check
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Check if a number is between 10 and 20 [76].
questions.solution_explanation: Utilize logical AND to combine two range comparisons [76].

questions.title: Pointer Matrix Multiplier
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Perform matrix multiplication using pointers [77].
questions.solution_explanation: Iteratively calculate dot products using pointer references to 2D array elements [77].

questions.title: Basic Max/Min Array
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find maximum and minimum elements in an array [78].
questions.solution_explanation: Assign first element as max/min and compare with all others [78].

questions.title: Function Min/Max Pointers
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find max/min of two values via pointer return function [79].
questions.solution_explanation: Update external max/min variables from inside a function using pointers [79].

questions.title: Largest of Three
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Find the largest among three numbers [80].
questions.solution_explanation: Compare three variables using nested if-else or logic gates [80, 81].

questions.title: Merge Arrays
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Combine two arrays into a third array [82].
questions.solution_explanation: Copy elements from first and then second array sequentially into a destination array [82].

questions.title: Word Counter
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Count the number of words in a multi-line string [83].
questions.solution_explanation: Count space characters and newline characters as word boundaries [83].

questions.title: String Palindrome Check
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Check if a string reads the same forward and backward [83].
questions.solution_explanation: Compare characters from outer boundaries moving inward [31, 32, 83, 84].

questions.title: Pointer Palindrome
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Verify palindrome string using pointers [32].
questions.solution_explanation: Use start and end pointers to compare characters until they meet [32].

questions.title: Prime Range
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Display all prime numbers between two limits [85].
questions.solution_explanation: Iterate through the range and perform primality tests for each number [85].

questions.title: Prime Sum Range
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Calculate the sum of primes in a specific range [86].
questions.solution_explanation: Find primes in range and add them to a total sum [86].

questions.title: Prime Function
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Use a function to check if a number is prime [87].
questions.solution_explanation: Encapsulate primality logic within a helper method returning count of factors [86, 87].

questions.title: Remove Duplicates
questions.question_statement: Write a program to solve: Remove duplicate characters from a string [80].
questions.solution_explanation: Scan string for repeat characters and shift array elements to delete them [80].
